text:
P1: Excuse me, could you help me?
P2: Yes, what seems to be the problem?
P1: Well. I was wondering if anyone has turned in a passport?
P2: I am afraid not. Have you lost your passport?
P1: I think so. I can't find it anywhere in my hotel room and I remember the last place I used it yesterday was in this department store.
P2: Where exactly did you use your passport in the store?
P1: In the shoe department. I had to show it to pay for these shoes with my traveler's cheques.
P2: Well, let me call the shoe department to see if they'Ve found a passport. Sorry, your passport hasn't turned up there either.
P1: Then what shall I do?
P2: You can fill in this lost property report and I will keep my eye out for it. These kinds of things usually turn up eventually, but I suggest you contact your embassy and tell them about your situation, so they can issue you a new passport in case it doesn't show up.
P1: You are right. Do you have a pen?
P2: Here you are.
P1: Oh, I seem to lose something every time I travel.
